{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cephalic index is a measure of the width and length of the skull. It is calculated by dividing the maximum width of the skull by the maximum length and multiplying by 100. A cephalic index of more than 80% indicates a relatively wider skull compared to its length. Based on this information, the correct answer is A. Brachycephalic, which refers to a relatively short and wide skull.", "answer_choice": "A"}
